page.title: 05SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: In the survey of our area the things that give people most cause for concern are unemployment, rates and nuclear weapons.Thirty four per.cent. of those interviewed gave rateable values as their prior concern in 1985. Another 44% said it was unemployment.The remainder mentioned nuclear weapons first. The local issues that are uppermost in their minds are vandalism, the state of repair of council housing, the state of the roads and pavements, the lack of leisure facilities, the way that ratepayers money is "squandered." Each of these issues were mentioned by between 10 and 12 per.cent. of those interviewed. One person said he is annoyed by the attitudes of Asian immigrants in the area and the apparent apathy of the local people.
